content.summary: Bootleg Fire: Catastrophic burn patterns across 413,765 acres (53% high severity) - largest US fire of 2021.
content.detail: Analysis of MTBS satellite imagery reveals 53% of the 413,765-acre fire experienced high-severity burn. Ten sectors identified across Fremont-Winema NF. Sprague River North (BOOT-001) and Summer Lake Basin (BOOT-005) show complete stand replacement with critical watershed and reforestation concerns. High severity: 218,400 acres. Moderate: 139,665 acres. Low: 55,700 acres. Tribal coordination required for Chiloquin Ridge and Heritage Trail areas.

content.summary: Critical trail damage: 4 bridges destroyed including historic OC&E trestle. $1.2M repairs needed across 87.7 miles.
content.detail: Assessment of 6 trails reveals 18 damage points including 4 bridge failures. Historic OC&E Woods Line trestle requires $320K structural assessment and repair - highest priority. Fremont NRT has 42.5 miles within fire with Sprague River crossing failed. Klamath Tribes Heritage Trail requires mandatory tribal consultation before any work. Bridge failures: OC&E trestle (historic), Sprague River (steel), Log stringer (Fremont NRT), Sycan River boardwalk. 348 crew-days needed for full restoration.

properties.label: Sprague River Unit A - Premium Ponderosa

content.summary: Salvage opportunity: 77.1 MBF across 8 plots. Premium ponderosa at risk of beetle damage - 18-month window.
content.detail: Cruise data from 8 plots indicates significant salvage potential in fire-killed ponderosa pine and lodgepole stands. Sprague River Unit A (BOOT-47-ALPHA) contains 14.1 MBF/acre premium ponderosa with excellent access - highest priority. Yamsay Flats (BOOT-17-GOLF) has large-diameter sawlogs at 11.4 MBF/acre on flat terrain. Bly Mountain unit (BOOT-61-DELTA) requires northern spotted owl survey before operations. Species mix: 52% Ponderosa Pine, 26% Lodgepole Pine, 19% White Fir. Beetle activity beginning in highest-value units.

content.summary: Complex NEPA pathway: Tribal consultation MANDATORY for 2 units. Spotted owl surveys required. ESD available but timeline critical.
content.detail: Bootleg Fire qualifies for expedited review under multiple authorities but has significant constraints. Categorical Exclusion available for hazard tree removal (250-acre limit). Emergency Situation Determination enables expedited EA - 180-day window from declaration. CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS: (1) Klamath Tribes consultation MANDATORY for Heritage Trail and Chiloquin Buffer - 60-day minimum process per MOA; (2) Northern spotted owl protocol surveys required in Bly Mountain unit - March-August survey season; (3) Wilderness adjacency at Gearhart requires additional analysis for mechanized equipment.

Recommending parallel process: CE for immediate trail work; tribal consultation + owl surveys for salvage

content.summary: Bootleg Fire Recovery Synthesis: Tribal consultation is critical path. $4M investment, $27.1M salvage potential.
content.detail: Cross-agent analysis complete for largest 2021 US wildfire. Critical dependency identified: Klamath Tribes consultation (60-day minimum) is the critical path for all operations affecting Heritage Trail and Chiloquin areas. Recommended sequence: 1) Immediately initiate tribal consultation, 2) Apply CE for trail hazard removal (parallel), 3) File ESD documentation for salvage, 4) Contract spotted owl surveys for Bly Mountain, 5) Begin Sprague River Unit A salvage once regulatory clearance obtained. Total investment: $4.0M (trails + salvage prep). Projected salvage revenue: $27.1M. Risk factors: 6-month owl survey window, tribal consultation timeline, beetle degradation.
